channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Target was hoping for a back-to-school sales bump that never game. Foot traffic is still down for the 7th month in a row
item.description: In August, foot traffic fell 3.3% year over year for Target.

item.title: ‘We’ll see if I can hold my nose and approve it’: Judge hates $1.5b AI settlement with book authors so much he’s taking 2 weeks to think it over
item.description: After spending nearly an hour mostly lambasting Anthropic's settlement, Judge William Alsup scheduled another hearing on September 25.

item.title: Tesla bull Dan Ives now chairs a company hoarding a Sam Altman-linked cryptocurrency. He’s not the only big name to enter the treasury race
item.description: Digital asset treasury companies increasingly turn to Wall Street celebrities to stand out in a crowded field.

item.title: Amazon, IBM, and Dell helped build China’s surveillance state brick by brick, investigation finds
item.description: What started as ordinary tech sales to China became the foundation of a sweeping surveillance machine, powered by U.S. companies.

item.title: Tylenol maker’s stock lost billions after a rumor linking the medicine to autism. Wall Street says buy the dip as one bank sees a ‘major overreaction’
item.description: Canaccord Genuity went on social media to gauge the reaction. Even the MAHA crowd was mixed on this one.

item.title: Why crude-oil prices didn’t rally much after Israel’s attack in Qatar
Dow, S&P and Nasdaq book new record highs despite downward revision to jobs data
Think the S&P 500 is looking pricey? Here are 20 stocks to consider instead.
Oracle’s stock surges toward best day in years. These huge numbers explain why.
GameStop posts 5th straight quarterly profit, thanks to a big sales jump
